## Last Verse
<!--Put a short poem you created using chatGPT of 20 to 30 lines,here!-->

**In the Realm of Formula 1**

On winding tracks where legends race,  
Engines roar, the world in chase.  
A flash of color, a blur of might,  
Drivers poised, hearts set alight.  

The lights go out, the thrill begins,  
A symphony of speed where no one sins.  
Rubber meets asphalt, a fierce embrace,  
Every turn taken, a test of grace.  

Pit stops swift, a choreographed dance,  
Fuel and tires, a fleeting chance.  
Strategies plotted in whispers of air,  
Each second counts, no room for despair.  

Monaco glitters, Silverstone sings,  
Tracks like stories with hopes on their wings.  
Through rain and shine, they push the bounds,  
In the roar of engines, pure freedom sounds.  

Champions rise, the history unfolds,  
Tales of glory in victories bold.  
From the roar of Ferrari to Mercedes’ might,  
Every race a battle, every lap a fight.  

Through tire wear and engine strain,  
They chase the podium, the sweet refrain.  
In this dance of skill, where passion's spun,  
The world watches closely—Formula 1.  

With dreams in their hearts and speed in their veins,  
In this fierce ballet, nothing remains.  
For in the end, it’s more than just speed,  
It’s the spirit of racing, the fire we need.
